posts.author: eburro6416
posts.content: I have a question about how UMD works on the server for those who don't normally get access to it. If I have a monk and I can get my hands on a gem that provide UMD, will I be able to use any item and wands? Even if it is a small amount of UMD, like maybe 3 or 5.

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content:
No, for two reasons. First is that most magic items won't be usable if you only have three points if use magic device in them.

Secondly I believe that since use magic device is not cross-classable, even if you put an item that gives you points in use magic device, it won't give them to you.
it's like putting on a ring of animal empathy that gives you +10 to your skill. It's useless unless you're a ranger or druid.

Sent from my Pixel 3 using Tapatalk

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
As gkorjax has stated in his reply, UMD is not a cross-class skill.

Meaning only Bard, Rogue and Assassin have access to it. 

Items adding bonuses to UMD will not change this.

posts.content:
Still watching...👁 (just think of me as Sauron for now, and we should be fine)

Fortunately, the same is true with WoG as in standard vanilla rules as far as UMD goes, in that only the three classes Web mentions can access it. Obviously wizards and sorcerers don't need it, because they can use all magic devices anyway, but they still can't access certain class-specific items without the skill - for which they'd need either one of the aforementioned classes or the class itself.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
Actually there were only 7 palantiri. In Unfinished Tales there was mention of an 8th, but such knowledge would have been extinct in the Third Age. It was suggested there were more but there is no evidence to substantiate it. Sauron would only have had one — captured from Minas Ithil. Denethor had the one from Minas Arnor and Saruman had (and lost) the Orthanc stone. It is likely Elrond had one that was placed on Cirdan’s ship when Elrond departed Middle Earth at the end of the Third Age.

That’s if you want to be technical.
